instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , no audio , no speaker detect and no headphone detect
threads.message:
hi, 
                 had  a damaged jack  on board , before replacement it was not detecting the jack or speakers and had a greyed out volume icon , also upon fitting the new one still does not detect any headphones and  speakers . any possibilities of testing some outputs from <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> to determine if <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> is faulty and needs reflow or replacment . 
kindly advise 
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , no audio , no speaker detect and no headphone detect
threads.message: Does it chime? PRAM reset to be sure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , no audio , no speaker detect and no headphone detect
threads.message:
hi , 
         it does not chime and also upon Pram reset it does not chime . 
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , no audio , no speaker detect and no headphone detect
threads.message: Likely there is either parts knocked off around <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> or balls/traces under <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> got ripped up by the force when the jack was broken. Check some voltages around <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> first, 3V and 4.5V.
